Hotel Covell Review | Bon Appetit

Each of the nine rooms has a no-frills, boho feel, with big windows covered by white, flowy curtains and pops of color throughout (a gold dresser, blue headboard). There’s likely a Crosley record player in your room and Malin+Goetz soaps in the bathroom, making you feel more at home than in a hotel. But the best thing in the hotel is Bar Covell, the thimble-sized wine bar downstairs run by sommelier Matthew Kaner.PRACTICAL STUFF: Rooms start at $295. Since the hotel has a very limited amount of rooms, it’s best to book out as far ahead as you can.—Elyse InamineCourtesy of Mayne Marketing AgencyWE ALSO LOVEAce Hotel DTLAA hipster wonderland with a juice bar in the lobby and acoustic guitars in the roomsKismetMediterranean family-style feasting from morning to nightTiki-TiEverything you love about dive bars—plus paper umbrellas—in Los FelizExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
